description: A classic French pepper sauce that enhances the flavor of steak or chicken.
ingredient: [{"name": "oil", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "beef trimmings or chuck steak", "units": "g", "amount": 150}, {"name": "carrot", "units": "small", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "onion", "units": "small", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "celery rib", "units": "rib", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "mushroom", "units": "or 2 quartered", "amount": 1}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "g", "amount": 10}, {"name": "cognac or white wine", "units": "ml", "amount": 50}, {"name": "beef or veal stock", "units": "ml", "amount": 400}, {"name": "thyme", "units": "sprig", "amount": 1}, {"name": "bay leaf", "units": "small", "amount": 1}, {"name": "flour & butter paste (beurre manié)", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cornstarch", "units": "tsp", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "heavy cream", "units": "ml", "amount": 100}, {"name": "freshly cracked black pepper or green peppercorn", "units": "tbsp", "amount": 1}, {"name": "sea salt", "units": "to taste", "amount": null}]
step_by_step: 1. Dice your beef trimmings, carrot, onion, and celery. Crush your peppercorns. 2. Heat oil in a saucepan, add beef trimmings and brown. 3. Add carrot, onion, mushrooms, and celery, then add butter. 4. Add cognac and let it bubble. 5. Pour in hot beef stock, add thyme and bay leaf, and reduce. 6. Strain the sauce, thicken with beurre manié or cornstarch. 7. Stir in cream and season with pepper and salt.
notes: Try green peppercorns for a milder twist. Can be made ahead.
tags: sauce, peppercorns, classic, steak sauce, easy, bistrot
